application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers:

PLN-EX-20 (Block Plan); Location Plan; Existing Garden Layout; 03 (Drop Kerb Details, received on 20/09/2023); Existing Elevation (received on 20/09/2023); Proposed Elevation (received on 20/09/2023);Heritage statement; Design and Access Statement; Parking Provision Letter
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, pedestrian visibility splays should be provided at all times measuring 1.5m by 1.5m, with no obstruction more than 0.6m high for the vehicle access where it meets the back edge of the footway; these shall be established prior to the first use of the driveway and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: In the interest of highways safety in accordance with policy T3 of the London Plan (2021).
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building/ existing wall.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Formation of vehicle crossover; installation of new boundary wall and landscaping works on the front garden (following demolition of existing boundary wall)
